meanings.definition: Patient endurance of hardship or offense.
meanings.sent1: Her longanimity in the face of adversity inspired us all.
meanings.sent2: The teacher showed great longanimity towards the disruptive student.
meanings.sent3: Despite the constant teasing, his longanimity never wavered.
meanings.sent4: Her longanimity was a shield against the harsh words thrown at her.
meanings.sent5: The longanimity of the marathon runner amazed the spectators.

meanings.sent1: The longanimity of the mediator helped resolve the conflict peacefully.
meanings.sent2: Showing longanimity towards different opinions can lead to understanding.
meanings.sent3: His longanimity towards his little brother's antics was truly commendable.
meanings.sent4: In a world full of impatience, her longanimity stood out like a beacon.
meanings.sent5: The longanimity of the judge ensured a fair trial for all.
